snippet: The widow of Ray Easterling said that she had no plans to move and that she would continue advocating for better medical coverage for retired N.F.L. players with head injures.
abstract: Profile of Mary Ann Easterling, widow of former NFL player Ray Easterling, who committed suicide in April at age 62; Easterling says she will continue advocating for better medical coverage for retired NFL players with head injuries. Photos (M)
lead_paragraph: RICHMOND, Va. -- For Mary Ann Easterling, the prudent and less painful options, it might seem, are to move away and move on. Relocate from the home where she found the body of her husband, Ray, a handgun nearby, and the neighborhood where Ray, a former N.F.L. safety, would become disoriented on long-distance jogs, sometimes prompting one-woman search parties at 2 a.m.
